unit_learning_outcomes.description: Interpret statistical outputs in plain language.
Understand the link between quantitative research design, survey procedure and statistical analysis
Conduct original research using quantitative research methods.
Analyse survey data using appropriate statistical models.
Carry out a statistical analysis using SPSS.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Reading the materials required for the unit sessions

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Fully online/virtual
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
data.subject_search_title: SSCI2020 - Survey Research in the Social Sciences
data.description: The unit introduces students to the logic of quantitative social inquiry, with a specific focus on social surveys. Social surveys are widely employed in today’s social science workplaces, with an array of uses in policy-making, public debate and social research. Survey methodologies collect systematic information about cases and present this information in a structured ‘data grid’, which can be used to test theoretically informed hypotheses and inferences. Surveys are used in many different types of studies, from quasi-experiments to cross-sectional and longitudinal studies. Building on SSCI1000 and SSCI2010, the unit focuses on linking quantitative research design to data analysis, including the deductive logic of quantitative research and analysis. Students learn how to develop survey questionnaires and collect other forms of quantitative data, as well as how to use computer software to analyse survey data. The unit aims to show that credible findings from survey research are as reliant on collecting valid and reliable data as they are on applying relevant analytic techniques.
data.search_title: SSCI2020 - Survey Research in the Social Sciences

Surveys are used in many different types of studies, from quasi-experiments to cross-sectional and longitudinal studies. Building on SSCI1000 and SSCI2010, the unit focuses on linking quantitative research design to data analysis, including the deductive logic of quantitative research and analysis. Students learn how to develop survey questionnaires and collect other forms of quantitative data, as well as how to use computer software to analyse survey data. title: Survey Research in the Social Sciences
